intro: Commiphora ledermannii, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous sap. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers and has leathery, elliptical leaves. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. The sap of Commiphora ledermannii has been traditionally used for its medicinal and aromatic properties.
